description.narrative: Kipas Kagit A.S, a subsidiary of the Kipas Group, is embarking on a new project to set up a recycled fiber based greenfield corrugated paper and cardboard facility, with a capacity of 450,000- 480,000 tons per annum (tpa) in Kahramanmaras, Turkey. Through its corrugated cardboard investment, Kipas intends to take advantage of the growth of the packaging industry in Turkey, in particular in the South and Eastern parts of the country.

The project will create additional employment through 300 additional jobs in Kipas and indirectly in related fields, notably waste paper collection in a frontier region of Turkey. The project will increase the use of recycled paper and in turn improve the domestic waste paper recovery rate, especially in a frontier area. Moreover, the project will result in the production of high quality cardboard through the use of the most recent technology in the industry that will help substitute for imports. Kipas Kagit will also supply corrugators in the food packaging container business that contribute to improved efficiency in food distribution and ultimately lower costs, thereby helping with food security.The project will also be integrated with an on-site co-generation plant. It is expected that the waste ash from the co-generation plant will be used in the cement operations of Kipas.
